meanings.definition: Beyond or above the range of normal or merely physical human experience.
meanings.sent1: The sunset painted a transcendent sky, filled with colors beyond imagination.
meanings.sent2: The artist's transcendent talent captured the beauty of nature in a breathtaking painting.
meanings.sent3: The transcendent cake was so delicious, it seemed to transport me to a magical land.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a transcendent melody, lifting everyone's spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The transcendent view from the mountaintop left us in awe of the world's wonders.

meanings.sent1: His transcendent skills in basketball made him a star player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The transcendent beauty of the garden attracted visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The transcendent joke had everyone laughing uncontrollably at the party.
meanings.sent4: The transcendent speed of the cheetah amazed spectators at the zoo.
meanings.sent5: Her transcendent kindness touched the hearts of all who knew her.

meanings.definition: Existing apart from and not subject to the limitations of the material universe.
meanings.sent1: The ancient legend spoke of a transcendent being who could control the elements.
meanings.sent2: The transcendent power of the wizard was unmatched in the realm.
meanings.sent3: The transcendent technology in the sci-fi movie seemed like magic from another world.
meanings.sent4: His transcendent knowledge of the cosmos made him a renowned astronomer.
meanings.sent5: The transcendent energy of the sun sustains life on our planet.
